metadata.Title: CVE-2023-3772 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in the Linux kernelâ€™s IP framework for transformingpackets (XFRM subsystem). This issue may allow a malicious user withCAP_NET_ADMIN privileges to directly dereference a NULL pointer inxfrm_update_ae_params(), leading to a possible kernel crash and denial ofservice.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-3772` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-219-generic - 4.15.0-219.230
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-219-generic - 4.15.0-219.230
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-219-lowlatency - 4.15.0-219.230
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-5.4.0-152-generic - 5.4.0-166.183~18.04.2
linux-image-5.4.0-152-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-166.183~18.04.2
